subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Richard S. Johnson birdied three of the last four holes to shoot a six-under-par 64 on Sunday to win the U.S. Bank Championship in Milwaukee for his first PGA Tour victory. Johnson finished at 16-under 264 on the 6,759-yard Brown Deer Park Golf Course to beat Ken Duke by a stroke. He is the sixth golfer from Sweden to win on the tour and the seventh first-time winner this year. Johnson, the first-round leader, sank a birdie putt of about 12 feet on the par-4 17th hole to break a tie with Duke.
